problem: Let $n$ and $k$ be positive integers. The square in the $i$ th row and $j$ th column of an $n$-by-$n$ grid contains the number $i+j-k$. For which $n$ and $k$ is it possible to select $n$ squares from the grid, no two in the same row or column, such that the numbers contained in the selected squares are exactly $1,2, \ldots, n$?

Let $r_{n}$ be the $n$th smallest positive solution to $\tan x=x$, where the argument of tangent is in radians. Prove that

$$
0<r_{n+1}-r_{n}-\pi<\frac{1}{\left(n^{2}+n\right) \pi}
$$

for $n \geq 1$.

Let $n$ be a positive integer. Set $a_{n, 0}=1$. For $k \geq 0$, choose an integer $m_{n, k}$ uniformly at random from the set $\{1, \ldots, n\}$, and let

$$
a_{n, k+1}= \begin{cases}a_{n, k}+1, & \text { if } m_{n, k}>a_{n, k} \\ a_{n, k}, & \text { if } m_{n, k}=a_{n, k} \\ a_{n, k}-1, & \text { if } m_{n, k}<a_{n, k}\end{cases}
$$

Let $E(n)$ be the expected value of $a_{n, n}$. Determine $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} E(n) / n$.

Let $k$ and $m$ be positive integers. For a positive integer $n$, let $f(n)$ be the number of integer sequences $x_{1}, \ldots, x_{k}, y_{1}, \ldots, y_{m}, z$ satisfying $1 \leq x_{1} \leq \cdots \leq x_{k} \leq z \leq n$ and $1 \leq y_{1} \leq \cdots \leq y_{m} \leq z \leq n$. Show that $f(n)$ can be expressed as a polynomial in $n$ with nonnegative coefficients.

For a real number $a$, let $F_{a}(x)=\sum_{n \geq 1} n^{a} e^{2 n} x^{n^{2}}$ for $0 \leq x<1$. Find a real number $c$ such that

$$
\begin{aligned}
\lim _{x \rightarrow 1^{-}} F_{a}(x) e^{-1 /(1-x)} & =0 \quad \text { for all } a<c, \text { and } \\
\lim _{x \rightarrow 1^{-}} F_{a}(x) e^{-1 /(1-x)} & =\infty \quad \text { for all } a>c
\end{aligned}
$$
